meanings.definition: A unit of energy equal to one joule.
meanings.sent1: I learned in science class that a noule is a type of energy measurement.
meanings.sent2: The light bulb used up one noule of energy in an hour.
meanings.sent3: The little robot ran out of noules and stopped moving.
meanings.sent4: Her enthusiasm was like a noule, always full of energy and brightness.
meanings.sent5: The sun provides us with countless noules of energy every day.

meanings.definition: To strike or hit with the head.
meanings.sent1: The soccer player tried to noule the ball into the goal.
meanings.sent2: The goat tried to noule the fence to escape.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought it was funny to noule the pillow on the bed.
meanings.sent4: The ram nouled the gate open with a powerful force.
meanings.sent5: The giraffe nouled the tree to reach the leaves at the top.

meanings.sent1: She found a noule of clay on the ground and started sculpting.
meanings.sent2: The chef rolled the dough into a perfect noule for the pasta.
meanings.sent3: The cat played with a noule of yarn, batting it around the room.
meanings.sent4: The artist created a beautiful sculpture out of a single noule of clay.
meanings.sent5: The children built a fort out of noules of snow in the backyard.
